posts.title: Patron Picks From Open Book Hour: At Home Edition
posts.text: NYPL readers shared the books that have helped them get through these past few tumultuous months.

posts.title: A Reader That Never Sleeps: 9 Thrillers Set in New York
posts.text: Some people like autumnal reads that give them a warm, cozy feeling. These books won't do that.

posts.title: To the Beat of Her Own Drum: Ladies of the Beat Generation
posts.text: If you had to name an artist or writer from the Beat Generation, the core male group may first come to mind: Huncke, Ginsberg, Burroughs, Kerouac. But a group of women were creating their own literary works, and are considered by some to be the unsung heroes of the movement.
